snippet: A strike dragged into its fourth day as 600 clerical workers walked off the job and colleagues from the International Longshore and Warehouse Union refused to cross picket lines.
abstract: Nation’s busiest port complex in Los Angeles and Long Beach remains largely shut down as port workers’ strike drags into its fourth day, raising fears that work stoppage could hurt the region’s economy.
lead_paragraph: A strike dragged into its fourth day as 600 clerical workers walked off the job and colleagues from the International Longshore and Warehouse Union refused to cross picket lines.

headline.seo: Los Angeles and Long Beach Ports Shut Down by Strike
headline.main: Strike Shuts Down Los Angeles and Long Beach Ports
headline.print_headline: Strike Shuts Down Los Angeles and Long Beach Ports
